javadoc:
A {@link LayoutManager} that can be applied to a {@link FieldPanel}, allowing
 {@link Components} to be placed over a given field location.
 
 To apply it, use {@link Container#setLayout(LayoutManager)} to install it. In this case, the
 {@link Container} must be a {@link FieldPanel}. Then, use
 {@link Container#add(Component, Object)}, passing a {@link FieldLocation} as the constraint.
 Currently, you must call {@link #layoutContainer(Container)} manually after you add or remove
 any components.
 
 When this layout manager is removed from the {@link FieldPanel}, you should call
 {@link #unregister()} in order to dispose of internal resources.

methods.javadoc: Remove my callbacks from the {@link FieldPanel}
methods.name: unregister
methods.comment: Remove my callbacks from the FieldPanel

methods.name: addComponent
methods.comment: Add a component to be position over the given location

params.name: loc
params.comment: the location of the field to occlude

params.name: comp
params.comment: the component to be placed over the field

methods.name: removeComponent
methods.comment: Remove a component by its field location

return.comment: true if there was a component placed at the given location

methods.name: removeComponent

methods.javadoc: Tickle the layout manager, so we get a callback to map the components onto the layout.
methods.name: trickMapComponents
methods.comment: Tickle the layout manager, so we get a callback to map the components onto the layout.

methods.javadoc:
Add a listener for overlay layout events
@param listener the listener to add
methods.name: addLayoutListener
methods.comment: Add a listener for overlay layout events

methods.javadoc:
Remove a listener for overlay layout events
@param listener the listener to remove
methods.name: removeLayoutListener
methods.comment: Remove a listener for overlay layout events

methods.javadoc:
Get the list of register overlay layout event listeners
@return the array
methods.name: getLayoutListeners
methods.comment: Get the list of register overlay layout event listeners

methods.javadoc:
Fire the given overlay layout event to all registered listeners
@param ev
methods.name: fireLayoutListeners
methods.comment: Fire the given overlay layout event to all registered listeners

name: FieldPanelOverLayoutManager
comment:
A LayoutManager that can be applied to a FieldPanel, allowing
 Components to be placed over a given field location.
 
 To apply it, use Container#setLayout(LayoutManager) to install it. In this case, the
 Container must be a FieldPanel. Then, use
 Container#add(Component, Object), passing a FieldLocation as the constraint.
 Currently, you must call #layoutContainer(Container) manually after you add or remove
 any components.
 
 When this layout manager is removed from the FieldPanel, you should call
 #unregister() in order to dispose of internal resources.
